title: Road rage:Couple Crossing A Road With Baby Narrowly Escape Being Hit By A Drunk Driver After He Crashes On To Another Car
text:
Thanks To A Car Crash, Couple Crossing Road With Baby Narrowly Escape Being Hit By Speeding Drunk Driver

Thanks To A Car Crash, Couple Crossing Road With Baby Narrowly Escape Being Hit By Speeding Drunk Driver

A family of three walking across a street in Phoenix, Arizona was nearly hit and killed by a drunk driver, but a miraculous car crash saved their lives.

In the CCTV footage going viral, the couple were saved in the nick of time when another vehicle crashed into the Jeep, giving them enough time to run to the curb.

Facebook

The Phoenix Police Department released a video of the incident, calling the second car an 'angel'.

The crossing sign said it was OK to go, so the family stepped onto the crosswalk, but less than a minute later an SUV came speeding towards them.

The accident happened in Phoenix at 53rd Avenue and Indian School Road, according to Fox News.

Police said the driver of the Jeep, 23-year-old Ernesto Oveso, was under the influence and was combative with witnesses after he tried to take off and they wouldn't let him flee.

“He told them to get away and actually pulled out a knife and stabbed at the driver through the window,” the Fox News quotes Sgt. Tommy Thompsons of the Phoenix Police Department.

Reports state that Oveso and a female passenger got out of the jeep and started running. A witness followed them and Oveso stabbed one of the doors on their car. The cops arrested Oveso but the woman is still absconding.
